text: Hello guys, I have created a module with tabs and has two columns, it works well except I am having problems with the right column I have an image field that works also good but when editing from content editor when  I try to put exact height and width it doesn't work. What is the proper way to add size ( height and width ) ?
is there a default HubSpot module that could be used in a email template that pulls latest blog posts ?

Shoutout to whoever updated the CMS documentation to allow you to expand and collapse menu items in the sidebar without navigating you away from your current page. :raised_hands: Genuinely one of my most desired updates.

Hello, I was wondering if any one had some experience with migrating blogs out of HubSpot to WordPress? I'm in a project now where we got the plugins for the csv upload into WordPress, and we used the <https://bootstrapcreative.com/how-to-migrate-a-HubSpot-blog-to-wordpress> process here to get the text. What im getting stuck on is this portion;  `{% set export = blog_recent_posts('BLOG ID', 200) %}"post_title","post_slug","post_date","post_content","post_thumbnail","post_author","post_category",<br> {% for content in export %} "{{ content.name|forceescape }}","{{ content.slug|forceescape|replace('blog/', '') }}","{{ content.publish_date_localized|forceescape }}","{{ content.post_body|replace('"','""')|forceescape|escape_jinjava }}","{{ content.featured_image }}","{{ content.blog_post_author }}","{{ content.topic_list|forceescape|replace('[', '')|replace(']', '') }}"<br>{% endfor %}`  Running it with the `('BLOG ID', 200)`  gets the data i need for the 200 posts, but i have 400 posts to get, i thought i could change the 200 to 400 and be done but it only pulls the 200. Any guidance will be appreciated.

Does anyone know who we can talk to at HubSpot about missing features in the new APIs v/s Legacy?

For example the endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/communication-preferences/v3/status/email/> which looks to replace <https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/subscriptions> does not have a businessUnitId returned. How are we supposed to support multiple brands using this newer API? With the looming November 30th request to update our keys, I am seeing many of the older legacy API calls (in production systems) simply are not supported with the private app keys.
